CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Up at Charlotte Motor Speedway, drivers and their teams are getting their cars ready for Saturday's Bank of America 500, and NBC Charlotte's Dan Yesenosky got to experience what it's like to drive a real racecar. 
"It's a lot harder to get in this thing than you'd think," Yesenosky said. "I kind of wish I had a door." 
The engine blares, and when you hit the gas, you'd better be ready. 
"It just gives people the thrill to see what it's like, as you saw, in a race car," said Kurt Weinhart. 
Weinhart works with the NASCAR Racing Experience and gave Dan the chance to drive one of their sample cars. Fortunately he had plenty of space to operate in the Z Max Dragway parking lot. 
"You felt the tight turning in the steering wheel and they have a lot of horsepower," Weinhart said. "That's the thing about these cars." 
But if you're a diehard racing fan who wants to be in the seat itself, Weinhart says you have to sign up. 
"I have a great job, because you ask somebody how it was and they say 'awesome,'" Weinhart said. 
The experience is offered periodically here in Charlotte; Weinhart says the next one is in November. Read or Share this story: http://www.wcnc.com/story/sports/motor/nascar/2015/10/09/behind-the-wheel-of-a-racecar/73671246/ TOP VIDEOS
